race.name: Gravel Brazil
race.tagline: Brazilian coastal mountains—100km, 2,000m elevation, steep technical terrain in beach town paradise.

terrain.surface: 80% gravel, 20% dirt roads. Brazilian coastal mountains—steep climbs, technical descents. Loose gravel on descents. 2,000 m over 100 km. Beach town start/finish. Technical rating: 4/5.

biased_opinion.summary: Gravel Brazil is Brazilian coastal mountains—100 km, 2,000 m elevation. Founded ~2019. 80% gravel, 20% dirt. Steep climbs, technical descents (loose gravel). 800-1,000 riders. Balneário Camboriú beach town. September spring conditions (18-28°C). Affordable entry (R$400-R$600 / $80-$120). If you want Brazilian gravel adventure with beach town vibes, this is it. If you want local/domestic race, skip it. International destination race.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: Gravel Brazil is Brazilian coastal mountains with beach town finish. 100 km, 2,000 m, technical terrain. If you want Brazilian gravel destination race with affordable entry, this is it. If you want local/domestic, skip it. International travel required but beach town vibes and scenery make it worth it.

black_pill.title: INTERNATIONAL TRAVEL + STEEP TECHNICAL + HEAT/HUMIDITY
black_pill.reality: International travel to Brazil required. Florianópolis airport 80 km (1.5-hour drive). Steep (2,000 m / 100 km). Technical descents (loose gravel). September heat/humidity (18-28°C). 15-20% DNF. Language barrier (Portuguese). You'll pay $1,500+ total (flights + entry + lodging + travel). If you need local/domestic, this isn't it. If you want Brazilian beach town adventure, this is it. Affordable entry ($80-$120) but travel adds up.
black_pill.expectation_reset: Gravel Brazil is international destination race. Brazil travel required. Steep technical terrain. If you need local/domestic, skip it. If you want Brazilian coastal mountain adventure with beach town finish and affordable entry, this is it. Travel adds cost but experience is unique.

logistics.lodging_note: Balneário Camboriú beach town. Book early.
logistics.travel_summary: Fly to Florianópolis (FLN). Rental car needed (80 km, 1.5-hour drive to Balneário Camboriú). Beach town lodging—book early. Day-before packet pickup. Race September.
logistics.food_options: Aid stations on course. Post-race party in beach town.

course_description.character: 100 km, 2,000 m. 80% gravel, 20% dirt. Brazilian coastal mountains. Steep climbs, technical descents. Technical rating: 4/5.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Coastal Mountain Climbs
suffering_zones.description: Steep Brazilian coastal mountains. 2,000 m cumulative.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Low gears. Pace conservatively. Steep. Heat/humidity management.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Technical Descents
suffering_zones.description: Loose gravel descents. Steep. Technical rating 4/5.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: 38-42mm tires. Pick lines. Brake early. Technical.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Heat/Humidity
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: 3+ bottles. Hydrate at every aid. Manage heat/humidity.

course_description.signature_challenge: Steep Brazilian coastal mountains (2,000 m / 100 km) + technical descents + heat/humidity.

history.origin_story: Gravel Brazil founded ~2019. Brazilian coastal mountains gravel. 100 km, 800-1,000 riders. Balneário Camboriú beach town. Growing Brazilian gravel scene.
history.reputation: Brazilian gravel scene. Coastal mountains. Beach town. International destination.
